 role in metal coordination are shown in the Cu(I) bound, Cu(II) bound, and

 one of the most highly-conserved regions of the protein from [[Drosophila]] to

 bind heparan sulfate proteoglycans. ;  ]]

'Amyloid precursor protein' (APP) is an integral membrane protein expressed in
many tissues and concentrated in the synapses of neurons. Its primary
function is not known, though it has been implicated as a regulator of synapse
formation, neural plasticity
and iron export. APP is best known as the precursor
molecule whose proteolysis generates beta amyloid (AÎ²), a 37 to 49 amino acid
peptide whose amyloid fibrillar form is the primary component of amyloid plaques
found in the brains of Alzheimer's disease patients.
